alert.note: Alert for Mason (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 3:20PM EST until February 28 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Point Pleasant. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, The Addison, Blaville Road in Ohio is flooded and low lying areas surrounding Point Pleasant and vicinity are flooded due to backwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 40.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Sunday was 40.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 27.4 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.6 feet on 01/17/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EST.
